Description: Squat vase of the higher type, made of magnesite: the mouth is very narrow and it has a raised external rim. It is closed by a thin gold cover, secured by two turns of gold wire, twisted together at the ends. The cover is decorated with punch-marks, made from the underside. The base has been drilled right through to facilitate the hollowing of the interior, and would originally have been closed by a separate piece of stone, now missing.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 27, pl.IX, 10.
